unnormalised: **Automotive News: Decoding Fuel Efficiency for the Indian Driver**
normalised: **Automotive News: Decoding Fuel Efficiency for the Indian Driver**

unnormalised: New Delhi, October 26th – With rising fuel prices, understanding fuel efficiency is crucial for Indian car owners. Dr. Meena Sharma, a professor at IIT Kanpur specializing in automotive engineering, explains, "Fuel efficiency, typically measured in km per liter, is the distance your car travels on one liter of fuel." Several factors impact this, including driving habits, vehicle maintenance, and even tire pressure.
normalised: New Delhi, October twenty sixth – With rising fuel prices, understanding fuel efficiency is crucial for Indian car owners. Doctor Meena Sharma, a professor at I I T Kanpur specializing in automotive engineering, explains, "Fuel efficiency, typically measured in kilometer per liter, is the distance your car travels on one liter of fuel." Several factors impact this, including driving habits, vehicle maintenance, and even tire pressure.

unnormalised: Aggressive acceleration and frequent braking significantly reduce efficiency. Regular servicing, including oil changes and air filter replacements, is vital. Incorrect tire pressure can increase fuel consumption by up to 3%.
normalised: Aggressive acceleration and frequent braking significantly reduce efficiency. Regular servicing, including oil changes and air filter replacements, is vital. Incorrect tire pressure can increase fuel consumption by up to three percent.

unnormalised: The ARAI (Automotive Research Association of India) conducts fuel efficiency tests. However, real-world figures often differ. Consider a test drive on your usual route before purchasing. Investing in a BS6 compliant vehicle also contributes to better fuel economy. Beyond individual effort, adopting carpooling and public transport can further reduce fuel consumption and traffic congestion in cities like Mumbai and Bangalore. Some new vehicles boast impressive mileage - even exceeding 25 kmpl in certain conditions. Remember, saving fuel also saves Rs.!
